dataIdInfo.envirDesc: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; ESRI ArcGIS 10.0.3.3600

idCitation.otherCitDet: Antarctic Protected Areas Data source: Environmental Research & Assessment (2011)

dataIdInfo.idAbs: Antarctic Specially Protected Areas boundaries, including data on year of designation, status, management plans, etc

Consts.useLimit: Access to Environmental Research & Assessment (ERA) Antarctic Protected Areas Data (the ‘Data’) is provided on the understanding that you read and agree to the Terms and Conditions provided with the Data.

LegConsts.useLimit: SUMMARY: Neither the Data nor any Derivative Works (work derived from or based upon the Data) may be put to Commercial Use without the prior written permission of ERA. The Data may not be sub-licensed in whole or in part including within Derivative Works without the prior written permission of ERA. The Data in whole or in part may not be redistributed by any means including (but not limited to) electronic formats such as over the internet or on electronic media or storage devices without the prior written permission of ERA. You may publish the Data in whole or in part in derived form or format, including on-line, providing the Data are not downloadable in any GIS-compatible format, and providing you give Attribution of Credit. You shall ensure that appropriate citation and credit to ERA is clearly given in any publication or analysis involving the Data in any derived form or format. FULL TERMS AND CONDITIONS ARE DETAILED IN THE LICENCE PROVIDED WITH THE DATA.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

dataSource.srcDesc: Boundaries derived from a variety of sources detailed in attribute data, including GPS data, digitised from georeferenced maps and orthophotos, derived from coordinates specified in Management Plans, downloaded from or provided by Third Parties including the Australian Antarctic Division, the British Antarctic Survey, Gateway Antarctica (University of Canterbury), Italian National Antarctic Program (PNRA), Dipartimento di Scienze Ambientali (Università di Siena), and Instituto Antártico Chileno (INACH).
